data.title: Salsa is to die for!  Kekas are amazing too!
data.text: I stopped in Laredo while flying with some colleagues and used Yelp to find a place with good reviews near the airport.  This place was a little farther than we wanted to go, but it had good reviews and an interesting menu.  I was amazed with this food!  The salsa is probably some of the best that I've ever tasted and I've done my share of traveling and I am a huge fan of salsa.  I mean, "Wow!"  The kekas were something that I've never heard of before, but I wanted to try some vegetarian options since we had more flying to do and I didn't want to be miserable mid-flight.  There were plenty of options and all of them were delicious.  What a great restaurant! I have been hoping to make a stop in Laredo again to go to Las Kekas another time!

data.title: Delicious Kekas
data.text:
You can miss this little house on McPherson, and it might be hard to find parking, but the authentic Mayan cuisine served here is a treat! The gracious owner served us squash blossom, cochinita pibil, chicken mole, and huitlacoche 
kekas, which were a definite change from the usual fare in south Texas.

data.title: Underwhelmed
data.text: Nothing was good.  My plate was just okay. My date's plate was terrible.  Don't know it gets this ranking.

data.title: Dinner
data.text: We found this little gem while searching for a "local" place to eat.  Las Kekas is on McPherson,  in an old house.  The service and the food were great. I had coffee (Cafe de Olla - a Mexican style coffee brewed with cinnamon.  "Regular" coffee not available.  It was good though!) We both had kekas ... a Mexican pastry like an empenada ... mine was Keka de Huitlacoche (a fungus that grows in corn cobs)  .... to be honest,  I couldn't look at it or think about it;  however,  it was delicious!  My wife had Keka de flor de calabaza  (squash blossom) ... also delicious.  We both had platas  (plates) ... hers was cochinita pibil  (a pork stew) and mine was rajas con crema  (poblano pepper strips,  onion,  and kernel corn in a cream sauce). They come with rice and frijoles refritas  (refried beans that had chorizo and seasoning) ... both dinners were delicious!  We had postres  (dessert) ... I had choco flan and she had cheesecake .... also delicious and made here.  Parking could be an issue since the parking lot is a small lot with only 6 or 7 parking spaces.  Driveway is to the left side of the house.  Definitely worth finding though ... some of the absolute best Mexican food I've had! Oh,  to top it off,  1 coffee,  2 appetizers,  2 dinners,  and 2 desserts only cost $34! Awesome! 👍

data.title: Not Impress
data.text: Food is not Good at all. Ironically Expect for Hamburgers. Those are not that bad. On the plus side Service is good. But Food is NOT Mexican, Not even Tex-Mex.

data.title: Amazing
data.text:
Everything was absolutely amazing. Very authentic. Not your typical Tex-Mex. nothing wrong with Tex-Mex, this is just a very special place. The huitlacoche kekas are unbelievable.  I had never had these mushrooms, and I will be back for more. Tried them on the recommendation of the owner, and I was blown away. The cochinita pibil was also amazing, as was the pork in green sauce. Try this gem of a restaurant if you truly are a Mexican food lover. I am neither from Laredo or of Mexican heritage, but I love Mexican food. I love Tex-Mex as much as the next guy, but having been to Mexico several times, and having tried Tex-Mex all over the state, I can say this restaurant was special among all of them. 

Thank you Nico for the wonderful experience. 

I will be back.

data.title: Love the Kekas~
data.text: I love the Kekas- and I especially love the mole- it's sooo good.  This place is great- but the service is not so good- could use quite a bit of work, and that's dissapointing since it's not a big place and not many people the few times I've been there. They also do not serve mixed drinks- and only serve beer. So, although I love the food- we tend to skip it since we can't have a good drink with our dinner.

data.title: Authentic food from Mexico.
data.text: Las Kekas serves authentic Mexican foods, many influenced by old native styles of cooking. Small restaurant and limited parking, but worth the extra effort. Reasonable prices.

data.title: great little place to get great food in laredo.
data.text: very good food, small but cozy feeling, met the owner and she was great in trying her best to meet our expectations.

data.title: Excellent Mayan Kitchen
data.text: as true to to authentic as it gets a must stop if you have ever been to cancun or the surrounding area and love their food

data.title: Las kekas
data.text: Las kekas is a great restaurant because the owner is always there and she takes great care of the customers. And add to that amazing mayan plates that ive never tasted before but ive been very impressed by.They're  different fragrant and delicious taste that everytime i go there i order some random plate and im always impressed.

data.title: Where is the Parking?
data.text:
This actually is a traveler's tip and not an actual review of the restaurant. I am giving this a 3, even though we did not eat here. 

My husband I and drove here to eat tonight, but it turns out there is basically no parking. There is an extremely small lot in the back that had 2 spaces for compact cars and 4 spaces for regular cars (and no spot for us). So we left very disappointed, and are now trying to locate an alternative.

data.title: Awesome!
data.text: Different than any other Mexican food I've ever had, but delicious!!  They have traditional Mexican food (tacos, quesadillas, etc) as well as delicious foods I've never seen before  such as Mexican tortas. Definitely recommend.

data.title: Delicious authentic Mexican cuisine!!
data.text: If you are looking to experience authentic southern Mexican food you must absolutely visit this place! You will also feel transported deep into a small Mexican village when you visit this beautiful chic homie location! You will not be disappointed!

data.title: Authentic Oaxacan cuisine
data.text: This small restaurant offers mighty fine Mexican food. The kekas are fried empanadas stuffed with mushrooms,cheese,meats and even flor de calabaza. Traditional roast suckling pig is the best!

data.title: Authentic as it can get.
data.text: I was in Laredo for business and i wanted to eat at a local restaurant,  not  a franchise. I found it! The place is a converted house and I enjoyed every minute of it! I was there with my Japanese friend. We had a great time talking to the owner and the cook. The kekas were out of this world! I highly recommend this restaurant. Do yourself a favor and discover it!

data.title: Yum
data.text: Highly recommend. Never heard of a kekas before coming down to south Texas but wow. This place is a must. The food is flavorful and the place is cozy.

data.title: Delicious and Great Prices!
data.text: Beans are the best I've ever had! Very nice place and people. Came 2 days in a row. Lunch specials starting at 3.99 and filling. Salsa and chips are great too!

data.title: Amazing.
data.text:
I was in Laredo for work and stopped here. It's fabulous. The chips and salsa is amazing, the enchiladas were great and the prices are beyond reasonable. 
I would definitely return!

data.title: Great find in Laredo
data.text: This unassuming house in the middle of a neighborhood was home to one of the best meals I have ever had.  Most authentic meal I have had outside of Mexico.  Highly recommend Las Kekas, a definite "must go" in Laredo.
